summary: Many older adults need services as they age, such as meal programs or in-home care. Demand for programs that provide these services continues to grow as the U.S. population ages. Multiple agencies provide services for older adults. The Department of Health and Human Services coordinates with agencies to avoid duplication between programs. Some overlap between programs for older adults is beneficial because of variations in...
title: Older Americans: HHS Should Apply Leading Practices as It Coordinates Overlapping Programs
